data.title: Interesting Decor
data.text:
I usually don't bother reviewing restaurants unless I can say lots of good things about it. But my husband is a pizza elitist and this review is for him. 
The atmosphere is loud - like headache loud.
The wood fired pizza has a great smokey taste, but the toppings are sparse. When one is paying $15 for a pizza, more than $2-3.00 should be spent on the toppings.
Better looking pizzas come from Papa John's, Pizza Hut, and Digiornos.
Don't shoot the messenger.

data.title: Pizza and beer
data.text: Multiple options on beer but poor service and burnt crust pizza cannot be ignored. Too many other options in town available to make a return trip here worth the risk of a repeat performance!

data.title: Great Pizza, Great Beer Selection!
data.text: We love going to the Millstone! The pizza is just the right thinness and floppiness. Always an awesome beer selection. Looooove the giant warm chocolate chip cookie for dessert.

data.title: great pizza, great atmosphere
data.text: Fun place for a good pizza and lots of beer on tap. Good lunch specials. Many different types of beer on tap, service is ususally good.

data.title: Good Local Pizza Joint
data.text: Pizza is pretty good.  Service can be slow however.  Have visited several times.  Need to improve appetizers quality and selection.

data.title: Good pizza, regional beers, and vibe
data.text: Millstone was cool. The bar and taps in a rustic venue was paired with classic booths and tables, offering a nice balance for a family lunch. The thin crust brick oven fired pizzas were solid and delicious. Good regional beer selection. The meatball sandwiches were also well received and devoured. I would definitely stop in again for chow when passing by on I77, it's worth the slight diversion.

data.title: girls night out
data.text: Extremely slow service for a non-crowded Friday evening.  Had to clean our table off of rain water outdoors and go looking for a waiter to be seated.  Food was good but not great.  Large group at bar so guess the drinks are more popular than the food. Pizza was good but not the best.

data.title: Good Pizza / Nice Tap selection.
data.text:
Had Folks in for work and we went here to enjoy Wood fired Pizza, was surprised by the Happy Hour for beer until 7pm that lead into 1/2 Price pizzas at 8 ... Great Cheese pizza , Which lacks in the greater Charlotte  area as well antipasti salad that was all star. patio overlooks parking lot but other than that a great place for a beer & Pie. 
Swing around the corner to French Bakery for desert .

data.title: Great brick oven authentic Italian food
data.text: I have been here at this place many times and I have to say that the pizza and the antipasto was authentic in every way! We love the staff too!

data.title: Best Pizza in the South, Italian and NY style
data.text: I have eaten pizza in Rome and NY, among other places, and this is possibly my favorite! It is wood-fired (Napoli-style) and quite delicious! The owners imported the oven from Italy. The pizza choices are creative and the ingredients are fresh. This place has a fantastic beer and a decent wine menu. The salads feature homemade dressings and finish your meal with a cannoli! I am very picky when it comes to pizza and I think this place is awesome! Great value, too!

data.title: Good, But Pricey For Proportions!
data.text: I went there for a quick bite to eat before a meeting that I was going to in the area. I ordered the garlic knots, chicken caesar salad, and a bbq chicken pizza plus two beers. My bill was $34 before tip! Now mind you it was also happy hour! Let me start by saying that the food was really good. With that being said, let me get to the size of the items. First, the garlic knots were excellent, but I only got 6 that were smaller than doughnut holes. $5 was way too much for what I got compared to other pizza places where it would be less money and bigger knots. Secondly, was the side  chicken caesar salad. The caesar salad itself was good but real small like a mcdonald side salad for a dollar. Now the grilled chicken on it was lacking flavor and bland! The salad with chicken was $8! Again, way too much for what you get. Now here is the really bad part. I ordered the bbq chicken pizza which had as much topping on the whole pizza as what you would go other pizza places and have on one slice. The pizza was $12(see picture below). This is what I was mostly disappointed at. Also they were out of 3 of the happy hour beers. Other than that, service was great, and atmosphere was nice. Overall good if your not hungry or with your family. If I would have come here with my family of 6, I would have spent over $100 to feed everyone!

data.title: Good food but pricey
data.text:
I gave them three stars because of the value for what you get.  I had a Buffalo Chicken and added bacon. I had water to drink and one extra serving of salad dressing - with tip $20. The bacon was $3.50 extra and the additional dressing $0.50. 

The food was good and ingredients fresh. 

I was with a large group (15/16). The service was slow and they had some trouble getting everyone's check correct. However, this is to be expected with a group as large as ours.

data.title: True Italian pizza in downtown Rock Hill.
data.text: What do you get when you mix true Italian pizza  ingredients , a wood fired oven , and the best selection of beer in town? The answer is,  the best pizza experience this side of Rome.

data.title: Again and again!
data.text: Love this place.  Always different beer on tap.  Music playlist is the best in town.  Fun staff, great company (never any annoying/drunken patrons), just overall great atmosphere!

data.title: Great beer and service, OK Pizza
data.text: We really like going here, but really only for the beer selection, which is outstanding.  The food ranges from good (entrée salads) to poor (calamari).  The pizza somehow is never really satisfying though.  It just seems to be a little underdressed.  I'd like more toppings as the pies are baked in a wood oven, so you need some strong flavors to stand up to the smoky flavor.

data.title: Good beer selection with pizza below par.
data.text: I had a lunch with co-workers at Millstone one day.  The Mozzarella Panini was tiny and served cold.  The other three people had different sandwiches and none where happy with the quantity.  I decided to give them a second chance and ordered Funghi pizza.  It was ok but there are better pizza's around and I will not be going back unless it is to have a beer after work.

data.title: Great Pizza and Beer
data.text: The pizza is great, and the selection of craft beers is a total bonus. The place can get busy on weekends, but it's worth a wait.

data.title: A great slice and cool beer
data.text: We just stopped by for a cool pint and a stone cooked slice.  With its great atmosphere and fine food hard to beat in Rock Hill.  If you smile real nice you might get to keep the pint glass.  Thanks again  Doc'

data.title: Very nice local pizza house
data.text: First time trying millstone. Was really impressed with the pizza. We started off with house salad. I had lemon dressing wife had balsamic. Both were great. Ordered magarita pizza and we loved it. Crust was on point! Hard to beat brick oven pizza. Not a beer drinker so can't commit on that. We had the complimentary water they serve. Place has a rock n roll vibe and a rustic industrial feel to the place. Really cool place. Staff was attentive and polite.

data.title: Great pizza and decent beer selection
data.text:
Definitely a good place to go for solid brick oven pizza. They have a pretty wide selection of beers on tap, a lot of them from around this region. 

The place is in an old building downtown and they have done a great job highlighting the classic building while adding a modern touch. 

We like it for a lunch spot, but a casual dinner here would be great as well.
